title: Disperser
summary: A disperser is a one-sided extractor.[1] Where an extractor requires that every event gets the same probability under the uniform distribution and the extracted distribution, only the latter is required for a disperser. So for a disperser, an event A ⊆ { 0 , 1 } m {\displaystyle A\subseteq \{0,1\}^{m}} we have: P r U m [ A ] > 1 − ϵ {\displaystyle Pr_{U_{m}}[A]>1-\epsilon }
